properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Westerly winds up to 90 kilometres per hour are expected tonight. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-01T13:59:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-01T02:27:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0979011637.2020
Area: Schefferville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The northeasterly winds will reach 90 kilometres per hour tonight. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-01T14:09:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-09-30T22:47:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1860460391.2020

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Overnight lows will be in the O to -4C range tonight, with the coldest temperatures expected near the Alberta-Saskatchewan border. Today is the last day for Frost Advisories for Alberta this season. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-01T17:09:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-01T03:10:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1012454791.2020

properties.Title: Waterspout Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of waterspouts. Waterspout development is expected today through to Friday afternoon. Waterspouts are expected to be most widespread over Lake Ontario overnight and Friday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-10-01T23:11:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-01T07:12:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2914195993.2020
Area: Eastern Lake Ontario, Western Lake Ontario

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Fog has settled in areas west of the Mackenzie River, from Fort McPherson to Aklavik and towards the Beaufort Sea. Visibilities are expected to remain poor in fog or patchy fog until later this morning. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-01T18:11:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-01T10:34:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1439497531.2020
Area: Aklavik Region, South Delta Region including Ft. McPherson - Tsiigehtchic
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: southwesterly 100 km/h. Locations: Nain and vicinity. Time span: early Thursday morning until Thursday afternoon. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-01T16:57:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-01T00:58:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2943694904.2020
Area: Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Waterspout Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of waterspouts. Waterspout development is expected this afternoon and tonight over Lake Erie. Some isolated waterspout activity is also possible Friday afternoon and evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-10-01T23:17:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-01T07:18:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1262184440.2020
Area: Eastern Lake Erie, Western Lake Erie
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong winds near the Richardson Mountains tonight. East winds will peak at 80 gusting 100 this evening and then ease overnight in the wake of a front. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-01T15:14:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-01T01:11:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1167053608.2020
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:

Time span: early this morning until this afternoon. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
